page.title: 04ECOLOGY
page.content: {THE CLIMATE}is fairly moderate this being an inland area and sheltered by the Clee Hill, although the North facing hills do get slightly more rain and snow fall than the surrounding, more sheltered lower areas. Frost pockets occur in the valleys. Fogs and mists are slight compared with more Urban parts as there is very little air pollution. {The Weather.-Temperature. }So far during the 1980s the highest temperature recorded has been 33degs.C. and the lowest minus 19 degs.C. {Rainfall.}Total Annual rainfall varies from 712mm. to 810mm. with an average of 749 mm. this falls,throughout the year with only occasional very prolonged dry or wet spells. {Winds.}Severe Gales rarely occur to cause any structural damage.
